title: Ticket #3249: cpus=auto doesn't work in multi slot environment
description: The documentation claims that, with multiple SLOT_TYPEs defined, one should be able to set cpus=auto in the slot definition, but looking at the code, cpus=auto always means cpus=1.
remarks:
2012-Oct-09 10:03:53 by tstclair:
Do we have any details on this, b/c I'm pretty surprised by *this? e.g. did it repro on 7.8.5?

2012-Oct-09 11:14:17 by gthain:
Looking at the code, this has never worked.

2013-Oct-31 09:25:28 by jfrey:
I've attached a patch that fixes this problem. Cpus are now treated like memory. After cpus are assigned to slots with explicit cpu shares, the remaining cpus are split evenly amongst slots with cpu=auto. All slots must have at least one cpu, and some cpus may go unassigned if they can't be divided evenly.
